roleset.name: CAUSE TO fit
roleset.note: This roleset is reserved specifically for instances where an outside agent, arg0, is present, causing arg1 and arg2 to fit together. This is for the event of causing to fit, not for the state of fitting. For all corresponding adjectives and stative instances of the verb ("X fits Y"), use the .06 roleset.
FIT-V NOTES: Based on financial subcorpus. Comparison with 'match'. Member of VNcls adjust-26.9, funnel-9.3-2, fit-54.3. (from fit.01-v)

role.descr: agent, causer of fitting; must be present for this sense to apply

example.name: fit-v: with agent
example.text: Mary fit John for a new tuxedo.

example.name: fitting-n: Arg0, 1, and 2
example.text: The nurse's fitting the patient for a catheter was interrupted by the tornado sirens.

roleset.name: ready, primed
roleset.note: FIT-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on WordNet. (from fit.03-j)

roleset.name: have a paroxysm
roleset.note: FIT-N NOTES: Based on Bolt data. No comparison. No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie. (from fit.02-n)

example.name: fit-n: arg 1 only
example.text: This sent him into a fit of laughter

example.name: fit-n: Light verb
example.text: The right was having fits over it

roleset.name: in good physical condition; healthy and athletic
roleset.note: FIT-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on WordNet (from fit.02-j)

example.name: fit-j: with MNR
example.text: I'd wrestled skittish horses and helped round up cattle, backpacked, hiked and tracked, and was physically fit.

roleset.name: be the right size; stative sense
roleset.note: This roleset is reserved for all of the stative instances of the verb 'fit'. "X fits" and "X fits Y" belong here, not in .01.

FIT-V NOTES: Based on financial subcorpus. Comparison with 'match'. Member of VNcls adjust-26.9, funnel-9.3-2, fit-54.3. ADJ: causer of fitting doesn't seem compatible with adj realization, which tends to be used to mean "appropriate": arg1 is appropriate thing, arg2 is what arg1 is "fitting with". (from fit.01-v)
FIT-N NOTES: Based on nouns-00080. Comparison to fit.01-v. VN classes adjust-26.9, funnel-9.3-2, and fit-54.3. (from fit.01-n)
FIT-J NOTES: Updated by Julia based on BOLT-1, fit-v.01. (from fit.01-j)
FITTING-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from fitting.01-j)

roles.note: Doesn't include the verb's arg0 (from fit.01-j)

example.name: fit-v: merged objects
example.text: And with Al's record of being a delver and a detail guy, you can see how the two fit,'' said Alan Gottesman, an analyst with PaineWebber.

example.name: fit-v: with arg2 as location
example.text: Conner is supplying hard-disk drives for the machine, which-1 *trace*-1 weighs only six pounds and fits in a briefcase.

example.name: fit-v: split object
example.text: They also have argued that government proceedings notifying a company of potential responsibility don't fit the legal definition of a lawsuit; thus, such governmental proceedings aren't covered by the policies, the insurers say.
example.arg: government proceedings notifying a company of potential responsibility
the legal definition of a lawsuit

example.name: fit-v: Arg 1
example.text: it fit with the convention of aerobics instructors
example.arg: with the convention of aerobics instructors

example.name: fitting-n: Arg1, Arg1
example.text: They can then be arrested merely by virtue of their fitting the definition of trafficking or being otherwise valued by the state.

example.name: fit-n: With arg 2 (arg 1 is outside the span)
example.text: Sansui is a perfect fit for Polly Peck's electronics operation

example.name: fitting-j
example.text: I do think it *EXP*-1 is fitting [that he left wife # 2 for mistress and wife # 3]-1, because what goes around and all ......
example.arg: [that he left wife # 2 for mistress and wife # 3]-1

example.name: fitting-j: Two args
example.text: The music is fitting with the theme, if a little to too relaxing considering you are being chased by two flaming meteors intent of your destruction.
example.arg: if a little to too relaxing considering you are being chased by two flaming meteors intent of your destruction.

example.name: fit-j: suitable
example.text: He is fit for the job.

roleset.name: fit in a specific place due to suitable features
roleset.note: FIT_IN-V NOTES: Frame edited by Arrick (from fit.02-v)

role.descr: first or all things fitting in
second thing, fitting in with what

example.name: fit_in-v
example.text: In order *trace*-1 to fit in with China's Buddhists, he-1 shaved his own head

example.name: fitting_in-n: Arg1 and 2
example.text: His fitting in on the cheerleading squad was only hampered by his weak cartwheeling skills.
